result.execSummary:
The defendant Deanne Lyn Frease was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment of $100.00 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge= Payment to be made to the COC office by end of business day today.
5 days jail with huber, if in compliance with jail rules and regulations- Deft to report to the MCJ no later than 7pm on August 9, 2022.
Confiscation of the firearm and any ammunition. DNA Sample Due: 8-9-2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Atty provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty agrees.
ADA reads charge on Count 1.

Deft enters No Contest Plea.

Elements of offense.

Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty satisfied.
Factual basis.

Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2.

Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.

Payment of $100.00 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge= Payment to be made to the COC office by the end of business day today.

Appeal rights.
